trans-unit.source: Get started with Azure Notification Hubs | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get started with Azure Notification Hubs | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you learn how to use Azure Notification Hubs to push notifications to a Windows Store or Windows Phone 8.1 (non-Silverlight) application.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you learn how to use Azure Notification Hubs to push notifications to a Windows Store or Windows Phone 8.1 (non-Silverlight) application.

trans-unit.source: Getting started with Notification Hubs
trans-unit.target: Getting started with Notification Hubs

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to a Windows Store or Windows Phone 8.1 (non-Silverlight) application.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to a Windows Store or Windows Phone 8.1 (non-Silverlight) application.

trans-unit.source: If you are targeting Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight, please refer to the <link><linkText>Windows Phone</linkText><title></title></link> version.
trans-unit.target: If you are targeting Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight, please refer to the <link><linkText>Windows Phone</linkText><title></title></link> version.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you create a blank Windows Store app that receives push notifications by using the Windows Push Notification Service (WNS).
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you create a blank Windows Store app that receives push notifications by using the Windows Push Notification Service (WNS).

trans-unit.source: When you're finished, you'll be able to use your notification hub to broadcast push notifications to all the devices running your app.
trans-unit.target: When you're finished, you'll be able to use your notification hub to broadcast push notifications to all the devices running your app.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrates a simple broadcast scenario in using Notification Hubs.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrates a simple broadcast scenario in using Notification Hubs.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to follow along with the next tutorial to learn how to use Notification Hubs to address specific users and groups of devices.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to follow along with the next tutorial to learn how to use Notification Hubs to address specific users and groups of devices.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the following:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows with Update 2<html></html>This version of Visual Studio is required to create a universal app project.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows with Update 2<html></html>This version of Visual Studio is required to create a universal app project.

trans-unit.source: If you just want to create a Windows Store app, you need Visual Studio 2012 Express for Windows 8.
trans-unit.target: If you just want to create a Windows Store app, you need Visual Studio 2012 Express for Windows 8.

trans-unit.source: An active Windows Store account
trans-unit.target: An active Windows Store account

trans-unit.source: An active Azure account <html></html>If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: An active Azure account <html></html>If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <link><linkText>Azure Free Trial</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <link><linkText>Azure Free Trial</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Notification Hubs tutorials for Windows Store apps.
trans-unit.target: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Notification Hubs tutorials for Windows Store apps.

trans-unit.source: Register your app for the Windows Store
trans-unit.target: Register your app for the Windows Store

trans-unit.source: To send push notifications to Windows Store apps, you must associate your app to the Windows Store.
trans-unit.target: To send push notifications to Windows Store apps, you must associate your app to the Windows Store.

trans-unit.source: You must then configure your notification hub to integrate with WNS.
trans-unit.target: You must then configure your notification hub to integrate with WNS.

trans-unit.source: If you have not already registered your app, navigate to the Windows Dev Center, sign in with your Microsoft account, and then click Create a new app.
trans-unit.target: If you have not already registered your app, navigate to the Windows Dev Center, sign in with your Microsoft account, and then click Create a new app.

trans-unit.source: Type a name for your app and click Reserve app name.
trans-unit.target: Type a name for your app and click Reserve app name.

trans-unit.source: This creates a new Windows Store registration for your app.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new Windows Store registration for your app.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, create a new Visual C# Store Apps project by using the Blank App template.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, create a new Visual C# Store Apps project by using the Blank App template.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click the Windows Store app project, click Store, and then click Associate App with the Store....
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click the Windows Store app project, click Store, and then click Associate App with the Store....

trans-unit.source: The Associate Your App with the Windows Store wizard appears.
trans-unit.target: The Associate Your App with the Windows Store wizard appears.

trans-unit.source: In the wizard, click Sign in and then sign in with your Microsoft account.
trans-unit.target: In the wizard, click Sign in and then sign in with your Microsoft account.

trans-unit.source: Click the app that you registered in step 2, click Next, and then click Associate.
trans-unit.target: Click the app that you registered in step 2, click Next, and then click Associate.

trans-unit.source: This adds the required Windows Store registration information to the application manifest.
trans-unit.target: This adds the required Windows Store registration information to the application manifest.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Repeat steps 4–6 for the Windows Phone Store app project.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) Repeat steps 4–6 for the Windows Phone Store app project.

trans-unit.source: Back on the Windows Dev Center page for your new app, click Services, click Push notifications, and then click Live Services site under Windows Push Notification Services (WNS) and Microsoft Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: Back on the Windows Dev Center page for your new app, click Services, click Push notifications, and then click Live Services site under Windows Push Notification Services (WNS) and Microsoft Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: On the App Settings tab, make a note of the values of Client secret and Package security identifier (SID).
trans-unit.target: On the App Settings tab, make a note of the values of Client secret and Package security identifier (SID).

trans-unit.source: The client secret and package SID are important security credentials.
trans-unit.target: The client secret and package SID are important security credentials.

trans-unit.source: Do not share these values with anyone or distribute them with your app.
trans-unit.target: Do not share these values with anyone or distribute them with your app.

trans-unit.source: Configure your notification hub
trans-unit.target: Configure your notification hub

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure portal], and then click NEW at the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure portal], and then click NEW at the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: Click App Services, click Service Bus, click Notification Hub, and then click Quick Create.
trans-unit.target: Click App Services, click Service Bus, click Notification Hub, and then click Quick Create.

trans-unit.source: Type a name for your notification hub, select your desired region, and then click Create a New Notification Hub.
trans-unit.target: Type a name for your notification hub, select your desired region, and then click Create a New Notification Hub.

trans-unit.source: Click the namespace that you just created (usually *notification hub name*-ns), and then click the Configure tab at the top.
trans-unit.target: Click the namespace that you just created (usually *notification hub name*-ns), and then click the Configure tab at the top.

trans-unit.source: Select the Notification Hubs tab at the top, and then click the notification hub that you just created.
trans-unit.target: Select the Notification Hubs tab at the top, and then click the notification hub that you just created.

trans-unit.source: Select the Configure tab at the top, enter the Client secret and Package SID values that you obtained from WNS in the previous section, and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Select the Configure tab at the top, enter the Client secret and Package SID values that you obtained from WNS in the previous section, and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: Select the Dashboard tab at the top, and then click the Connection Information button at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Select the Dashboard tab at the top, and then click the Connection Information button at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Take note of the two connection strings.
trans-unit.target: Take note of the two connection strings.

trans-unit.source: Your notification hub is now configured to work with WNS, and you have the connection strings to register your app and send notifications.
trans-unit.target: Your notification hub is now configured to work with WNS, and you have the connection strings to register your app and send notifications.

trans-unit.source: Connect your app to the notification hub
trans-unit.target: Connect your app to the notification hub

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, right-click the solution, and then click Manage NuGet Packages.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, right-click the solution, and then click Manage NuGet Packages.

trans-unit.source: This displays the Manage NuGet Packages dialog box.
trans-unit.target: This displays the Manage NuGet Packages dialog box.

trans-unit.source: Search for WindowsAzure.Messaging.Managed and click Install, select all projects in the solution, and accept the terms of use.
trans-unit.target: Search for WindowsAzure.Messaging.Managed and click Install, select all projects in the solution, and accept the terms of use.

trans-unit.source: This downloads, installs, and adds a reference in all projects to the Azure Messaging library for Windows by using the <html></html>WindowsAzure.Messaging.Managed NuGet package<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: This downloads, installs, and adds a reference in all projects to the Azure Messaging library for Windows by using the <html></html>WindowsAzure.Messaging.Managed NuGet package<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: Open the App.xaml.cs project file and add the following using statements. In a universal project, this file is located in the .Shared folder.
trans-unit.target: Open the App.xaml.cs project file and add the following using statements. In a universal project, this file is located in the .Shared folder.

trans-unit.source: Also in App.xaml.cs, add the following InitNotificationsAsync method definition to the App class:
trans-unit.target: Also in App.xaml.cs, add the following InitNotificationsAsync method definition to the App class:

trans-unit.source: This code retrieves the channel URI for the app from WNS, and then registers that channel URI with your notification hub.
trans-unit.target: This code retrieves the channel URI for the app from WNS, and then registers that channel URI with your notification hub.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to replace the "hub name" placeholder with the name of the notification hub that appears in the portal on the Notification Hubs tab (for example, mynotificationhub2 in the previous example).
trans-unit.target: Make sure to replace the "hub name" placeholder with the name of the notification hub that appears in the portal on the Notification Hubs tab (for example, mynotificationhub2 in the previous example).

trans-unit.source: Also replace the connection string placeholder with the DefaultListenSharedAccessSignature connection string that you obtained in the previous section.
trans-unit.target: Also replace the connection string placeholder with the DefaultListenSharedAccessSignature connection string that you obtained in the previous section.

trans-unit.source: At the top of the OnLaunched event handler in App.xaml.cs, add the following call to the new InitNotificationsAsync method:
trans-unit.target: At the top of the OnLaunched event handler in App.xaml.cs, add the following call to the new InitNotificationsAsync method:

trans-unit.source: This guarantees that the channel URI is registered in your notification hub each time the application is launched.
trans-unit.target: This guarantees that the channel URI is registered in your notification hub each time the application is launched.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, double-click Package.appxmanifest of the Windows Store app, and then in Notifications, set Toast capable to Yes:
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, double-click Package.appxmanifest of the Windows Store app, and then in Notifications, set Toast capable to Yes:

trans-unit.source: From the File menu, click Save All.
trans-unit.target: From the File menu, click Save All.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Repeat the previous step in the Windows Phone Store app project.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) Repeat the previous step in the Windows Phone Store app project.

trans-unit.source: Press the F5 key to run the app.
trans-unit.target: Press the F5 key to run the app.

trans-unit.source: A pop-up dialog that contains the registration key is displayed.
trans-unit.target: A pop-up dialog that contains the registration key is displayed.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Repeat the previous step to run the other project.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) Repeat the previous step to run the other project.

trans-unit.source: Your app is now ready to receive toast notifications.
trans-unit.target: Your app is now ready to receive toast notifications.

trans-unit.source: Send the notification from your backend
trans-unit.target: Send the notification from your backend

trans-unit.source: You can send notifications by using Notification Hubs from any backend via the <html></html>REST interface<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: You can send notifications by using Notification Hubs from any backend via the <html></html>REST interface<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you send notifications by using a .NET console application.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you send notifications by using a .NET console application.

trans-unit.source: For an example of how to send notifications from an Azure Mobile Services backend that's integrated with Notification Hubs, see "Get started with push notifications in Mobile Services" (<link><linkText>.NET backend</linkText><title></title></link> | <link><linkText>JavaScript backend</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For an example of how to send notifications from an Azure Mobile Services backend that's integrated with Notification Hubs, see "Get started with push notifications in Mobile Services" (<link><linkText>.NET backend</linkText><title></title></link> | <link><linkText>JavaScript backend</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For an example of how to send notifications by using the REST APIs, see "How to use Notification Hubs from Java/PHP" (<link><linkText>Java</linkText><title></title></link> | <link><linkText>PHP</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For an example of how to send notifications by using the REST APIs, see "How to use Notification Hubs from Java/PHP" (<link><linkText>Java</linkText><title></title></link> | <link><linkText>PHP</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the solution, select Add and New Project..., and then under Visual C#, click Windows and Console Application, and click OK.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the solution, select Add and New Project..., and then under Visual C#, click Windows and Console Application, and click OK.

trans-unit.source: This adds a new Visual C# console application to the solution.
trans-unit.target: This adds a new Visual C# console application to the solution.

trans-unit.source: You can also do this in a separate solution.
trans-unit.target: You can also do this in a separate solution.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, click Tools, click NuGet Package Manager, and then click Package Manager Console.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, click Tools, click NuGet Package Manager, and then click Package Manager Console.

trans-unit.source: This displays the Package Manager Console in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: This displays the Package Manager Console in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: In the Package Manager Console window, set the Default project to your new console application project, and then in the console window, execute the following command:
trans-unit.target: In the Package Manager Console window, set the Default project to your new console application project, and then in the console window, execute the following command:

trans-unit.source: This adds a reference to the Azure Notification Hubs SDK using the <html></html>Microsoft.Azure.Notification Hubs NuGet package<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: This adds a reference to the Azure Notification Hubs SDK using the <html></html>Microsoft.Azure.Notification Hubs NuGet package<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: Open the Program.cs file and add the following using statement:
trans-unit.target: Open the Program.cs file and add the following using statement:

trans-unit.source: In the Program class, add the following method:
trans-unit.target: In the Program class, add the following method:

trans-unit.source: Make sure to replace the "hub name" placeholder with the name of the notification hub that appears in the portal on the Notification Hubs tab.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to replace the "hub name" placeholder with the name of the notification hub that appears in the portal on the Notification Hubs tab.

trans-unit.source: Also, replace the connection string placeholder with the connection string called DefaultFullSharedAccessSignature that you obtained in the section "Configure your notification hub."
trans-unit.target: Also, replace the connection string placeholder with the connection string called DefaultFullSharedAccessSignature that you obtained in the section "Configure your notification hub."

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you use the connection string that has Full access, not Listen access.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you use the connection string that has Full access, not Listen access.

trans-unit.source: The listen-access string does not have permissions to send notifications.
trans-unit.target: The listen-access string does not have permissions to send notifications.

trans-unit.source: Add the following lines in the Main method:
trans-unit.target: Add the following lines in the Main method:

trans-unit.source: Right-click the console application project in Visual Studio, and click Set as StartUp Project to set it as the startup project.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the console application project in Visual Studio, and click Set as StartUp Project to set it as the startup project.

trans-unit.source: Then press the F5 key to run the application.
trans-unit.target: Then press the F5 key to run the application.

trans-unit.source: You will receive a toast notification on all registered devices.
trans-unit.target: You will receive a toast notification on all registered devices.

trans-unit.source: Clicking or tapping the toast banner loads the app.
trans-unit.target: Clicking or tapping the toast banner loads the app.

trans-unit.source: You can find all the supported payloads in the [toast catalog], [tile catalog], and [badge overview] topics on MSDN.
trans-unit.target: You can find all the supported payloads in the [toast catalog], [tile catalog], and [badge overview] topics on MSDN.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: In this simple example, you sent broadcast notifications to all your Windows devices.
trans-unit.target: In this simple example, you sent broadcast notifications to all your Windows devices.

trans-unit.source: In order to target specific users, refer to the tutorial [Use Notification Hubs to push notifications to users].
trans-unit.target: In order to target specific users, refer to the tutorial [Use Notification Hubs to push notifications to users].

trans-unit.source: If you want to segment your users by interest groups, see [Use Notification Hubs to send breaking news].
trans-unit.target: If you want to segment your users by interest groups, see [Use Notification Hubs to send breaking news].

trans-unit.source: To learn more about how to use Notification Hubs, see [Notification Hubs Guidance].
trans-unit.target: To learn more about how to use Notification Hubs, see [Notification Hubs Guidance].
